ZetaFish.NetworkObjects
Class ZFDeck

java.lang.Object
  ZetaFish.NetworkObjects.ZFDeck
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ZFDeck
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

An object of type Deck represents a deck of playing cards. The deck is a regulate poker deck that contains 52 regular cards and that can also optionally include two Jokers. Taken in part from: Introduction to Programming Using Java, Fifth Edition math.hws.edu/javanotes/source/Deck.java Design 4.6.6 v1.5

See Also:

          Constructs a regular 52-card poker deck.

Constructor Detail

ZFDeck

public ZFDeck()
Constructs a regular 52-card poker deck. Initially, the cards are in a sorted order. The shuffle() method can be called to randomize the order. Design 7.1.15.1 v1.5

Method Detail

shuffle

public void shuffle()
Put all the used cards back into the deck (if any), and shuffle the deck into a random order.

cardsLeft

public int cardsLeft()
As cards are dealt from the deck, the number of cards left decreases. This function returns the number of cards that are still left in the deck.

dealCard

public ZFCard dealCard()
Removes the next card from the deck and return it. It is illegal to call this method if there are no more cards in the deck. You can check the number of cards remaining by calling the cardsLeft() function.

Returns:
the card which is removed from the deck.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there are no cards left in the deck

replaceCards

public void replaceCards(ZFCard[] cards)
Returns cards to the deck.

Parameters:
cards - The cards to return to the deck

replaceCard

public void replaceCard(ZFCard card)
Returns a single card to the deck.

Parameters:
card - Card to return to the deck.
